OSI-774, erlotinib, or TARCEVA™ (erlotinib HCl) has an IC50 of 2 nM (Moyer, J. D. et al. (1997) Cancer Res. 57:4838-4848).
CI-1033 (formerly known as PD183805; Pfizer) has a Ki of 1.8 nM (Sherwood et al., 1999, Proc. Am. Assoc. Cancer Res. 40:723).

AG-1478 (University of California) has an IC50 of 3.1 nM.

PKI-166 (Novartis) has an IC50 of 5.5 nM.
EKB-569 (Wyeth) has an IC50 of 0.86 nM.
GW-2016 (also known as GW-572016 or lapatinib ditosylate; GSK) has an IC50 of 10.2 nM.
Gefitinib (also known as ZD1839 or IRESSA™; Astrazeneca) has an IC50 of 0.079 uM (Woodburn et al., 1997, Proc. Am. Assoc. Cancer Res. 38:633).
